com.constantcontact.authentication.components
Class AuthenticationConnection

java.lang.Object
  com.constantcontact.authentication.components.AuthenticationConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class AuthenticationConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Models an Authentication Connection in Constant Contact.
Class to encapsulate the two connections needed during authentication flow.
Since authentication consists of a back and forward ping-pong between HTTPS and HTTP, two connections are needed: a secured one and a non-secured one.

Author:
ConstantContact
See Also:

Constructor Detail

AuthenticationConnection

public AuthenticationConnection(java.lang.String urlParam,
                                boolean doConnectAfterOpen,
                                ProcessorBase.HttpMethod httpMethod)
                         throws ConstantContactAuthenticationException
Class constructor.
You are allowed to call only this one - the default constructor was made private to avoid usage.

Parameters:
urlParam - The url.
doConnectAfterOpen - Connect After Open flag : tells if connection will be connected right after open, or left as it is.
httpMethod - The HTTP method
Throws:
ConstantContactAuthenticationException - When there is a problem in the authentication flow / server answered with an unexpected response.
